hints.content: Let's count how many lion tail's measured $45\text{ cm}$.

One lion, Alex, had a tail that measured $\greenE{45}\text{ cm}$  

So, we place $1$ dot over $\greenE{45}$ on the number line.  

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/da19f5d726faeb04ce70752118997042a6678fe4)
Now, let's graph the other measurements on the table.

Here is the completed line plot:

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7d62709101fc821019a89114d860fd8539327bf4)

question.content:
The zookeepers measured the length of all the lions' tails.   They  are going to make a line plot of the data.  

Lion | Tail length ($\text{cm}$)
:-: | :-: | :-:
Kitty | $49$
Alex | $45$
Roar | $47$
Leona | $47$
Lionesse | $48$


**Graph the measurements from the table on the line plot.**   
*Click above the line plot to make dots for each of the measurements.*

[[â˜ƒ plotter 1]]
